intro: Rupalleya, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plants typically grow in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring moist, rocky soils. Rupalleya species are often found in mountainous areas of Asia, including the Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau. They play an important role in the ecological systems of their native habitats.
